name: df-ray
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cray, coprab(s0, s1, s2, wrex(s3, cn, wa(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cee, cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cee, cv(s3))), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s2), crab(s4, cfv(cee, cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s0), coutsideof, cop(cv(s1), cv(s4)))))))))
comment: Define the ` Ray ` function. This function generates the set of all points that lie on the ray starting at ` p ` and passing through ` a ` . Definition 6.8 of [Schwabhauser] p. 44. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Oct-2013.)
